definition: To transfer someone or something to a specific location, typically involving a formal process or institution. This action is commonly associated with the transportation of individuals to a medical facility, prison, or similar establishment.

examples.german: Ich muss meinen Hund in die Tierklinik einliefern.
examples.english: I have to admit my dog to the animal clinic.

examples.german: Der Dieb wurde von der Polizei ins Gef√§ngnis eingeliefert.
examples.english: The thief was taken to jail by the police.

examples.german: Der Patient wurde in das Krankenhaus eingeliefert.
examples.english: The patient was admitted to the hospital.

examples.german: Die Ware wird morgen in das Lager eingeliefert.
examples.english: The goods will be delivered to the warehouse tomorrow.

examples.german: Der Brief muss bis 17 Uhr eingeliefert werden, um noch heute verschickt zu werden.
examples.english: The letter must be submitted by 5 pm in order to be sent today.
